###MOTIVATION FOR TENSORS:
<br>

From [this post](https://jeremykun.com/2014/01/17/how-to-conquer-tensorphobia/):

Examples of multilinear maps:

1. If $V$ is an inner product space over $\mathbb{R},$ then the inner product is bilinear.
2. Matrix multiplication as an operation.
2. The determinant of a matrix is a multilinear map if we view the columns of the matrix as vector arguments.
3. The cross product of vectors in $\mathbb{R}^3$ is bilinear.

---

#####Inner products:

$$\left( \begin{bmatrix} 3\\2\\1 \end{bmatrix} \cdot\color{red}{\begin{bmatrix} 4\\-1\\2 \end{bmatrix} } \right)+
\left( \begin{bmatrix} 1\\2\\3 \end{bmatrix} \cdot \color{red}{\begin{bmatrix} 4\\-1\\2 \end{bmatrix}}  \right)
=
\left( \begin{bmatrix} 3\\2\\1 \end{bmatrix} +\begin{bmatrix} 1\\2\\3 \end{bmatrix}  \right) \cdot \color{red}{\begin{bmatrix} 4\\-1\\2 \end{bmatrix}}
$$

#####Matrices:

$$\left( \begin{bmatrix} 6&2\\0&-1 \end{bmatrix} \, \color{red}{\begin{bmatrix} 1&2\\3&-1 \end{bmatrix}}\right)+\left( \begin{bmatrix} 4&2\\0&-5 \end{bmatrix} \, \color{red}{\begin{bmatrix} 1&2\\3&-1 \end{bmatrix}}\right)=\left( \begin{bmatrix} 6&2\\0&-1 \end{bmatrix} + \begin{bmatrix} 4&2\\0&-5 \end{bmatrix}\right)\,\color{red}{\begin{bmatrix} 1&2\\3&-1 \end{bmatrix}}$$
